Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.1. Dero: The account is significantly past due or has been sent to collections, charged off, or involved in severe negative activity.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.2. Dero: The account has a derogatory status, but the specific details (e.g., late payments, charge-off) are unclear or not fully reported.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.3. Dero: Likely a system-generated code indicating derogatory status that fails a specific reporting standard or format.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.4. Dero: The account was in derogatory status at the time it was closed, often reflecting unresolved delinquencies or defaults.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.5. Open: The account is currently open but has late payments associated with it.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.6. Inde: The accountâ€™s status is unclear or lacks sufficient information to determine its condition.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.7. Clos: The account is no longer active and has been closed by either the creditor or the consumer. May or may not reflect a negative history.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.8. Paid: The account has been fully paid off and carries a zero balance. This is a positive status.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.9. Othe: A generic designation for accounts that do not fit standard status categories.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.10. Unk: The status of the account is not reported or cannot be determined.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.11. Ope: The account is active and currently in use, with no mention of delinquency or derogatory activity.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.12. Tra: The account has been transferred to another creditor, often due to refinancing, sale, or internal reallocation.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.13. Ref: The account has been paid off and replaced with a new loan or credit arrangement under modified terms.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.14. - /: Placeholder or missing value; no status is provided.
Creditfixrr Account Statuses.pdf.\u00e2\: â€¢ Paid: Reflects responsible repayment behavior. â€¢ Open: Indicates ongoing, active accounts with no derogatory remarks.
â€¢ Transferred / Refinanced: Typically neutral unless tied to derogatory activity.
â€¢ Derogatory: Significantly impacts credit scores and remains on reports for up to 7 years. â€¢ Derogatory Closed: Indicates unresolved negative activity at the time of closure.
â€¢ Indeterminate / Unknown: May require follow-up with the creditor to clarify the account's true status.

Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.Here are th: 1. - 2. -- 3. Account relationship terminated 4. Authorized User 5. Authorized account 6. AuthorizedUser 7. Co-maker 8. Co-maker/Signer 9. Co-signer on account 10. Comaker 11. Cosigner 12. Deceased 13. Individual 14. Individual Account 15. Individual account 16. Joint 17. Joint Account 18. Joint account 19. JointContractualLiability 20. Maker 21. Primary borrower on account 22. Responsible in Case of Default 23. Shared 24. Signer 25. Terminated 26. Undesignated 27. (empty or missing value) Hereâ€™s what each of the listed bureau codes typically means in the context of
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.1. - / --:: Placeholder or missing value; no specific designation for the account relationship.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.2. Account: Indicates that the account relationship has ended, either through account closure or other termination events.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.3. Authoriz: A person who has permission to use a credit account but is not legally responsible for repaying the debt. Common with credit cards.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.4. Co-maker: A person who co-signs a loan and shares equal responsibility for repayment with the primary borrower.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.5. Co-signe: A person who guarantees the repayment of a loan but is not the primary account holder. They are responsible for repayment if the primary borrower defaults.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.6. Deceased: Indicates the account holder is reported as deceased. The account might be closed or flagged for special handling.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.7. Individu: The account is solely owned by one person, who is entirely responsible for the debt and account management.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.8. Joint /: An account shared by two or more individuals, who are equally responsible for repayment.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.9. JointCon: Indicates a legal agreement where all joint account holders are responsible for the debt, per the account terms.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.10. Maker:: Refers to the primary borrower or the individual who initiates and signs for the loan.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.11. Primary: The person primarily responsible for the account's debt and management.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.12. Respons: Identifies the person(s) obligated to pay the debt if the primary borrower defaults.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.13. Shared:: Refers to an account jointly managed or owned but may not imply equal financial liability unless explicitly stated.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.14. Signer:: Refers to a person who signed for the account or loan, typically carrying some responsibility for repayment.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.15. Termina: Indicates that the account or relationship associated with it has been formally ended.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.16. Undesig: A placeholder or undefined relationship type that lacks a clear designation.
Creditfixrr Bureau Codes.pdf.How They Af: â€¢ Responsibility: Codes like Co-maker, Joint, or Cosigner reflect shared or partial responsibility for an account, which affects how the account is reported on credit files. â€¢ Authorized User: Accounts reported under this code may appear on the credit report of the authorized user but do not hold them liable for repayment. â€¢ Closed/Terminated Accounts: Codes such as Account relationship terminated or Terminated typically indicate the account is no longer active but may still show a payment history. â€¢ Deceased: Once reported, accounts with this code may be removed from credit reporting or flagged for estate handling. â€¢ Undesignated: May result in inaccuracies or incomplete reporting, potentially requiring clarification from the creditor.

Late 30 Days 11. Late 60 Days 12. Late 90 Days 13. Repossession 14. Repossession/Foreclosure 15. Too New to Rate 16. Unknown 17. Wage Earner Plan 18. (empty or missing value)
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.1. - / --:: Placeholder or missing value; no specific late status is assigned.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.2. Collect: Indicates that the account has been sent to collections or charged off as a bad debt due to severe delinquency (usually 180+ days late).
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.3. Current: The account is up-to-date, with no late payments reported.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.4. Foreclo: The property secured by the loan has been repossessed by the lender due to non-payment.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.5. Informa: Indicates that late status details are not available or were not provided by the creditor.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.6. Late 12: The account is 120 days late on payments, a severe level of delinquency.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.7. Late 15: The account is 150 days late on payments, nearing charge-off status.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.8. Late 18: The account is 180 days late on payments, often resulting in charge-off or collection.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.9. Late 30: The account is 30 days late on payments, a minor delinquency.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.10. Late 6: The account is 60 days late on payments, a moderate delinquency.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.11. Late 9: The account is 90 days late on payments, a serious delinquency.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.12. Reposs: Property or assets tied to the loan have been repossessed by the creditor due to non-payment.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.13. Reposs: Indicates that repossession or foreclosure has occurred, depending on the type of secured asset.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.14. Too Ne: The account is too new for any late payment or performance data to be available.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.15. Unknow: Placeholder for accounts where the late status cannot be determined.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.16. Wage E: Indicates the account is part of a repayment plan, such as those under Chapter 13 bankruptcy.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.17. (empty: No late status was provided or reported by the creditor.
Creditfixrr Late Statuses.pdf.Impact of: â€¢ Severity of Late Payments: The greater the number of late days (e.g., 120, 150, 180), the more significant the impact on a credit score. â€¢ Current Status: Positive indicator if the account is marked as Current. â€¢ Charge-offs, Foreclosures, and Repossessions: These severe statuses can remain on a credit report for up to 7 years and significantly lower creditworthiness. â€¢ Information Gaps: Missing or unknown data can result in reporting inaccuracies that may need clarification with the creditor.

Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.1. - /: Placeholder or missing value; no payment status was provided. 2. 120 days past due / 30 days past due / 60 days past due / 90 days past
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.due:: Indicates the number of days the payment is overdue. The higher the number, the more severe the delinquency.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.3. 30,: Indicates a history of missed payments with increasing severity, including being past due by 120 days or more.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.4. Acco: The account has been modified, either through refinancing or renewing terms.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.5. Acco: The account has been transferred to a different department or institution, such as collections.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.6. AsAg: The account is being paid as per the agreed-upon terms.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.7. At l: Severe delinquency where the account is overdue by at least four payment cycles.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.8. Bank: Indicates that the debt is included in a bankruptcy filing or a wage earner plan (e.g., Chapter 13 bankruptcy).
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.9. CONT: Indicates incomplete or missing data; creditors must contact the borrower for updates.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.10. Cha: The lender has written off the account as uncollectible, typically after 180+ days of non-payment.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.11. Col: The debt has been sent to a collection agency due to non-payment.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.12. Con: Indicates that the consumer tied to the account is reported as deceased.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.13. Cre: The creditor was initially unable to locate the account holder but has since reestablished contact.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.14. Cre: Indicates foreclosure or repossession of collateral tied to the account.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.15. Cre: The account is flagged due to a lost or stolen credit card.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.16. Cre: The lender is unable to contact the borrower.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.17. Cur: The account is up-to-date with no missed payments.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.18. Cur: Payments are current, but the foreclosure process was initiated at some point. 19. Debt included in or discharged through Bankruptcy Chapter 13 /
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.Bankrup: The debt has been included in a bankruptcy filing and may no longer be collectible.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.20. For: The property securing the loan is being or has been repossessed due to non-payment.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.21. Inc: The account is part of a Chapter 13 bankruptcy repayment plan.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.22. Lat: Indicates how many days the payment is overdue, with increasing severity as the number grows.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.23. Leg: Debt settled for less than the total amount owed, often in collections or settlement agreements.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.24. No: No payment status is provided. 25. Not more than two payments past due / Not more than four payments
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.past du: Indicates the account is overdue but within a limited number of payment cycles.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.26. Now: The account was previously charged off but is now being repaid.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.27. Pai: The account has been fully paid or is being paid according to the agreement.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.28. Pai: The account was previously in collections or charged off but has since been paid.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.29. Pas: Indicates how many days the account is overdue.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.30. Pay: Payment was made after the account had been charged off or sent to collections.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.31. Rep: Property or collateral tied to the account was repossessed due to non- payment. 32. Seriously past due date / assigned to attorney, collection agency, or
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.credit: Indicates severe delinquency and possible legal action or external collections.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.33. Too: The account is too new to have sufficient payment history.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.34. Unk: Placeholder for accounts where the payment status is unclear.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.35. Unp: The account has an outstanding balance with no payments made.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.36. Vol: The borrower voluntarily returned collateral to the lender due to inability to pay.
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.37. Wag: Indicates the account is part of a court-approved repayment plan (e.g., Chapter 13 bankruptcy).
Creditfixrr Payment Statuses.pdf.Impact: â€¢ Late Payments: The severity (e.g., 30, 60, 120 days) impacts credit scores significantly. â€¢ Charge-offs and Collections: These statuses remain on credit reports for up to 7 years and greatly affect creditworthiness. â€¢ Positive Indicators: Accounts marked as Current or Paid reflect positively on credit scores. â€¢ Bankruptcy and Repossession: These statuses signal severe financial distress and have long-lasting impacts.

Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.S: Hereâ€™s what each public record status typically means in the context of credit
Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.1: Placeholder or missing value; no specific status was provided.
Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.2: The public record (e.g., bankruptcy) has been completed, and the associated debts have been resolved or forgiven.
Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.3: The public record case (e.g., bankruptcy or judgment) was closed without resolution, often due to noncompliance or ineligibility.
Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.4: Indicates that the public record case (e.g., bankruptcy or lien) has been officially filed in court but has not yet been resolved.
Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.5: The status of the public record is unclear or not provided by the reporting entity.
Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.6: Placeholder for records where the status cannot be determined.
Creditfixrr Public Record Statuses.pdf.\: Reflects that legal action has begun, such as a bankruptcy filing or a lien against property. This can lower credit scores but may be updated as the case progresses.
A positive outcome for the debtor in a bankruptcy case, as debts are forgiven. However, the discharged record will still remain on the credit report for the specified time (7-10 years).
Indicates that the case did not resolve in favor of the filer, leaving debts unresolved and potentially impacting credit negatively.
These may require follow-up with the reporting entity for clarification, as incomplete records can affect credit accuracy.

Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.Sorte: Hereâ€™s what each public record type typically means in the context of credit
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.1. -: Placeholder or missing value; no specific record type provided.
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.2. Ba: General references to bankruptcy filings under Chapter 7 or Chapter 13 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code. 3. Bankruptcy Chapter13-petition filed / Bankruptcy chapter 7-petition
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.filed: Indicates a formal filing of Chapter 13 or Chapter 7 bankruptcy with the court. 4. Bankruptcy chapter 13-discharged / Bankruptcy: Discharged CH-13 /
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.Chapt: The court has cleared the debtor's obligations under Chapter 13 after successful completion of the repayment plan. 5. Bankruptcy chapter 13-dismissed / Bankruptcy: Dismissed CH-13 /
The Chapter 13 case was dismissed, often because the debtor did not comply with the repayment plan or court requirements. 6. Bankruptcy chapter 7-discharged / Bankruptcy: Discharged CH-7 /
Indicates the successful completion of a Chapter 7 bankruptcy, where most debts are forgiven. 7. Bankruptcy chapter 7-dismissed / Bankruptcy: Dismissed CH-7 /
The Chapter 7 case was dismissed, often due to ineligibility, noncompliance, or procedural issues.
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.8. Ch: General references to bankruptcy filings under Chapter 13 or Chapter 7.
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.9. Ch: Indicates that the debtor has filed for bankruptcy under the respective chapters.
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.10. C: The debtor voluntarily withdrew their Chapter 13 bankruptcy filing.
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.11. C: Obligations for court-ordered child support payments. Overdue payments may be recorded as public records if legal action is taken to enforce collection.
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.12. B: Indicates that a Chapter 13 bankruptcy case has been initiated.
Creditfixrr Public Record Type.pdf.\u00e: â€¢ Bankruptcies severely impact credit scores and remain on reports for 7 years (Chapter 13) or 10 years (Chapter 7) from the filing date. â€¢ A "discharged" status indicates successful completion, whereas "dismissed" signals that the case did not conclude favorably for the filer. â€¢ Filing, discharge, or dismissal of a bankruptcy all appear as distinct records.
â€¢ Unpaid child support can be recorded as a public record, affecting credit scores. â€¢ Often associated with legal enforcement actions like wage garnishments or liens.
â€¢ Dismissed bankruptcies reflect negatively but are less severe than a discharged bankruptcy because debts were not resolved through the court.

â€¢ These may indicate that the filer chose to withdraw the case, which can be neutral to negative depending on the context. Let me know if you need additional clarification or further elaboration on any specific type!

Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.S: Below is a summary of the report comments in the context of credit reporting, grouped by their common implications or categories.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.1: Placeholder or missing value; no specific comment provided.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.2: The account has been closed, and the balance is fully paid.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.3: Indicates the account is no longer active and has been formally closed.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.4: The consumer disputes the account information after it was marked resolved.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.5: The consumer has filed a dispute regarding the accuracy of the account details.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.6: The dispute is under reinvestigation, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA). 7. Account was in dispute - now resolved - report as disputed by
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.c: The dispute has been resolved, but the consumer still considers the account disputed.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.8: Indicates that the creditor has written off the account as uncollectible.

Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.1: The account was charged off, but partial payment was received.
The collection account has been fully paid.
The account is included in a Chapter 7 bankruptcy filing.
Refers to overdue child or family support payments, often enforced through legal action.
Indicates that a court judgment or lien has been filed against the consumer for the debt.

Indicates that the account terms or status were impacted by a natural disaster, often resulting in leniency.
Refers to the type of interest rate applied to the account.
Indicates a credit card with adjustable spending limits.
Indicates that the creditor was previously unable to locate the consumer but has now established contact.
Creditfixrr Report CommentsRemarks.pdf.\: These reflect disputes filed by consumers under the FCRA, requiring creditors to investigate and validate the account information. They can temporarily affect credit reporting.
Severe derogatory statuses like charge-offs and collections have long- term impacts on credit scores and remain on reports for up to 7 years.
Positive comments like "Paid" or "Settlement accepted" indicate progress toward resolving negative accounts.
Comments like "Affected by natural disaster" or "Active military duty" show accommodations due to unique situations.
